topic.title: Adding the Rados Gateway to Existing Cloud

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The Entry-scale KVM with Ceph model in has been extended to include support for RADOS Gateway. If you are upgrading an existing cloud and you want to enable RADOS Gateway functionality, you will need to add new servers, roles, disk models and clusters to your model.

This describes how to add a RADOS Gateway component to a pre-deployed Helion OpenStack cloud that is not running this service. Before you add the RADOS Gateway component to an existing cloud, you should be aware of the networking aspects of the entry-scale-kvm-ceph model. See here for more details.
Follow the Upgrade Instructions to upgrade a running HOS 2.x cloud to HOS 3.0. Once the cloud is upgraded, perform the following steps to configure the RADOS Gateway service.

To add a RADOS Gateway:
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml to add the following values under the clusters section:- name: rgw cluster-prefix: rgw server-role: RGW-ROLE min-count: 0 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-client - ceph-radosgw - apache2
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/server_roles.yml to add the following values:- name: RGW-ROLE interface-model: RGW-INTERFACES disk-model: RGW-DISKS
Copy the ~/helion/examples/entry-scale-kvm-ceph/data/disks_rgw.yml file to ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/ directory of your input model.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/net_interfaces.yml file and update the network interfaces to match the deployment environment appropriately:- name: RGW-INTERFACES network-interfaces: - name: BOND0 device: name: bond0 bond-data: options: mode: active-backup miimon: 200 primary: hed3 provider: linux devices: - name: hed3 - name: hed4 network-groups: - MANAGEMENT - OSD-CLIENTIf your Ceph deployment does not have a dedicated network for client traffic, you must remove the OSD-CLIENT network from the network-groups mentioned above for RGW-INTERFACES.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/network_groups.yml file to add the RADOS Gateway service (ceph-radosgw) to the OSD-CLIENT network group:- name: OSD-CLIENT hostname-suffix: osd-client component-endpoints: - ceph-monitor - ceph-osd - ceph-radosgwThis step only needs to be performed if your Ceph deployment has a dedicated network for client traffic i.e. if you are using the single-network model for Ceph cluster then you must skip this step.By default TLS is enabled for the RADOS Gateway public endpoint. If you want to disable TLS for RADOS Gateway, follow the procedures mentioned here.
The above steps are required to be performed only once after upgrade. To add RADOS Gateway node you can proceed with the procedure mentioned here.
